intro: Portulaca cordobensis, commonly known as the Cordoba moss rose, is a flowering plant native to Argentina. It is a low-growing, succulent species that thrives in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant features fleshy, rounded leaves and produces vibrant, showy flowers in shades of red, yellow, and orange. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its ability to store water in its thick stems and leaves. Portulaca cordobensis is often used in rock gardens and as a ground cover due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
